intro: Centropogon longipetiolatus, commonly known as the long-petioled centropogon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated petioles that support its opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent corona. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
